meanings.definition: To expel or force out again.
meanings.sent1: After the meeting, they decided to reexpel the troublemaker from the group.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was reexpelling the incorrect answers from the test papers.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner seemed to be reexpelling the dust back into the room!
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a volcano reexpelling its fiery lava.
meanings.sent5: The storm was reexpelling the leaves from the trees with great force.

meanings.definition: The act of expelling or forcing out again.
meanings.sent1: The reexpelling of the intruders from the building was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent2: She witnessed the reexpelling of water from the flooded area.
meanings.sent3: The reexpelling of confetti at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The reexpelling of air from the balloon created a funny sound.
meanings.sent5: The reexpelling of seeds from the pod was a fascinating sight to behold.
